body:
Problem:  A 'rulerformat' not part of the statusline is not emitted through
          msg_ruler events.
Solution: Build the message chunks to emit as a msg_ruler event.

Fix #35682

comment_data.body:
Caveat here that this does not convey combined highlight groups. Would need to adapt the "message chunks" API signature to include that.

Just making it `[attr_id, text, group_id, combine_id]` would technically be non-breaking I suppose. IDK if we would then include a 0 `combine_id` in other places. And/or if a breaking change removing `attr_id` and making `group_id` an array (so it can be passed to `nvim_buf_set_extmark()` directly) should be considered @bfredl.
Why are `User*` highlights now also combined with `StatusLine`?
I don't think you should call `hl_combine_attr()` when `curattr == attr`.

I added an early return, which I thought was already there.

EDIT: this caused an [error](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/17615122534/job/50046174279?pr=35707#step:10:10057) for some reason...

nit: "External" is not a great name for this concept. Besides the fact that all UIs are technically external, the distinction is more like "default UI" vs "extensible/structured UI". 

So `ext_ui` is perhaps a more common name that avoids some confusion.

The only other place that use "external" is `win_config.c`, so this isn't a very common thing.

I've read "_externalize_" in various places, but yes you're right that it is also used as short for "UI _extensions_" in others. Externalize does show up a few times with `grep "externalize" **/*`, and even in `api-ui-events.txt`. But happy to change it.

> I've read "_externalize_" in various places,

yeah, that's old stuff that we need to clean up. Avoiding it reduces the cleanup work.

comment_regular_data.body: A UI that has implemented the event correctly will just benefit from this automatically. I added a news entry regardless.
